Just another WordPress.com site July 23, 2011 Fast food conspiracy By bjarnetree Okay, I am not much of a conspiracy theorist, but I definitely believe there is a conspiracy in the fast food industry. I went to a certain fast food restaurant and ordered a fish sandwich, a bottled water and a small fry. I was told that it was cheaper to get a super value meal which includes the sandwich, a large fry and a gigantic sugary pop. I told the worker that I didn’t want that much food and I didn’t like pop. She frowned and said,“suit yourself…it’s just going to cost a lot more.”A lot more?! Why? Wouldn’t it be logical that the less food you have, the cheaper it would be? And it was more expensive…insanely more expensive in fact. I started paying attention to menus and realized that all fast food restaurants do this insane practice; they charge immensely for those who do not want to be in a fat-induced coma by the age of 25.
I am by no means a health-nut, as my friends would attest to, however, why are those of us who are trying to be frugal and eat in moderation penalized. At one fast food restaurant, it was suggested that I order the value meal, have them trade out the pop for water and just not eat it all. Um…okay…wasteful much? I supposed I could feed the extra fries to the birds, but really…I just want a small fry!
My frustration with this phenomenon has turned encouraged me to stop going to fast food restaurants all together…which is good. I just hope that other businesses learn from the fast food chains. Wouldn’t it be great if it was cheaper to get all of your groceries for $20.00 if you bought them all at the same time? Or what if it would be cheaper to get a couch for the price of a love-seat? Even better, a King size bed would be cheaper than a twin. This conspiracy has been going on for a long time; I think it is time for other businesses to pick up on the trend. Momma needs a king-size bed!
